abstract.text: An object that manages the HTTP cookies associated with a particular web view.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: to specify the initial cookies for your webpages, and to manage cookies for your web content. For example, you might use this object to delete the cookie for the current session when the user logs out. To detect when the webpage changes a cookie, install a cookie observer using the
object directly. Instead, retrieve this object from the
object in your web view’s configuration object.

abstract.text: The local files WebKit can access when loading content.
Integrate web content seamlessly into your app, and customize content interactions to meet your app’s needs.
An object that manages the HTTP cookies associated with a particular web view.
An enumeration with cases that indicate whether a cookie store allows cookie storage.
Adds an observer to the cookie store.
Deletes the specified cookie.
Fetches all stored cookies asynchronously and delivers them to the specified completion handler.
Returns a cookie policy that indicates whether the cookie store allows cookie storage.
Removes an observer from the cookie store.
Adds a cookie to the cookie store.
Sets a cookie policy that indicates whether the cookie store allows cookie storage.
The methods to adopt in an object that monitors changes to a webpage’s cookies.
A protocol for loading resources with URL schemes that WebKit doesn’t handle.
An interface that WebKit uses to request custom resources from your app.
A record of the data that a particular website stores persistently.
An object that manages cookies, disk and memory caches, and other types of data for a web view.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
